Retold in graphic novel form, Sherlock Holmes attempts to solve the murder of a Herefordshire landowner, whose estranged son has been accused of the crime. Includes a section explaining Holmes's reasoning and the clues he used to solve the mystery.

Retold in graphic novel form, Sherlock Holmes investigates why busts of Napoleon are being smashed throughout London. Includes a section explaining Holmes's reasoning and the clues he used to solve the mystery.
Sherlock Holmes and the adventure at the Copper Beeches /
based on the stories by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle ; adapted by Murray Shaw and M.J. Cosson ; illustrated by Sophie Rohrbach and J.T. Morrow.
On the case with Holmes and Watson ;

Retold in graphic novel form, Sherlock Holmes investigates if there is danger afoot when a young woman is asked to cut off her long hair and dress in a specific blue gown in order to be hired as governess at the Copper Beeches. Includes a section explaining Holmes's reasoning and the clues he used to solve the mystery.
Sherlock Holmes and the Redheaded League /
based on the stories of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle ; adapted by Murray Shaw and M.J. Cosson ; illustrated by Sophie Rohrbach and J.T. Morrow.
On the case with Holmes and Watson ;

Retold in graphic novel form, Sherlock Holmes comes to the aid of a pawnbroker who has joined a club to earn extra money, but suspects something nefarious is happening in his shop while he his away. Includes a section explaining Holmes's reasoning and the clues he used to solve the mystery.
